page.title: 09INDUSTRY IN SUTON
page.content: Visit of group to Farmhand. Farmhand moved to Suton in 1970 and were bought by the Danish company T-T Agro in 1983. They import agricultural machinery and distribute to dealers. In 1970 machinery came in containers in parts and 90 people assembled it here. Now it comes complete and 34 people work here in sales, engineering, stores and accounts. It arrives at Felixstowe and comes by road to Suton from Denmark, Finland, Italy and USA. Farmhand still have the first 1968 tractor imported by them, however, UK is still the largest producer of tractors and Farmhand even export second-hand tractors to Finland. Machines seen included loaders, round balers,complete diet feeders (Â£14,500), fertiliser spreaders and drills.
